title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 52.12 - Interrogatories
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 52.12 - Interrogatories

State Regulations
(a) Where it has been
determined that a witness who is outside the State of New York will voluntarily answer interrogatories, the trial examiner may prepare
interrogatories to be answered by such witness and the registrant shall have the opportunity to prepare cross-interrogatories as prescribed in this
section. (b) The interrogatories and cross-interrogatories shall be settled and forwarded by the hearing
officer to be answered in writing and subscribed to under oath by such witness. Upon application to the Attorney General, the Attorney General may
make an order providing for the taking of such witness's oral testimony pursuant to the settled interrogatories by a person designated by the

Attorney General. The expenses of taking such testimony shall be borne by the applicant therefor unless the Attorney General provides
otherwise. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
52.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
